page.title: 08Hatcliffe
page.content: Manor Farm, Hatcliffe is run by Miss Allis. They grow crops such as clover seeds, mustard, oil seed rape, beans and she also breeds beef cows. Miss Allis has lived at Manor Farm for 46 years. The land has changed from sheep to arable. The village of Hatcliffe is one of the prettiest villages around. It is purely residential. In the actual village of Hatcliffe there are 29 houses. There have been quite bad floods over the years because there is a stream running through the village. The most recent flood was in 1981. Hatcliffe's church is called St Mary's, which was built in the 13th century. There was an old chapel, school house and a post office. Now they all have been converted into houses. The oldest cottage is Cherry Tree Cottage which was built in 16 C.
